titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the 200th birthday celebration of the Library of Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-542.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 190.

action.text: Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 279.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Senate Committee on Rules and Administration discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 4/3/2000--Passed House amended. Authorizes the Library of Congress to sponsor its 200th birthday celebration on the Capitol Grounds on April 24, 2000 (or any other date the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate may jointly designate), subject to specified conditions. Prohibits any arrangement to limit access to any public road on the Capitol grounds.
